item.title: [REQ] - Tzhaar fightcave respawn
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:12, topic:552478”]I said to remove the first if statement
Instead, you removed the second one.

Use tabbing to understand how the code will be read…

if (c.inFightCaves()) { c.isSkulled = false; c.skullTimer = 0; c.attackedPlayers.clear(); // ^Everything above this line shouldn't be within the if statement movePlayer(3101, 3494, 0); // This should be. } else { movePlayer(2439, 5169, 0);// This should be in the else statement. c.getPA().resetTzhaar();// This should be in the if statement, not the else statement. }[/quote]

i tried it 2 ways like this if (c.inFightCaves()) { c.getPA().resetTzhaar(); movePlayer(3101, 3494, 0); } else { movePlayer(2439, 5169, 0); } c.isSkulled = false; c.skullTimer = 0; c.attackedPlayers.clear();

and like this still the same thing happens.

if (c.inFightCaves()) { c.getPA().resetTzhaar(); movePlayer(3101, 3494, 0); } else { movePlayer(2439, 5169, 0); c.isSkulled = false; c.skullTimer = 0; c.attackedPlayers.clear(); }

Read full topic

item.title: [REQ] - Tzhaar fightcave respawn
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

I said to remove the first if statement
Instead, you removed the second one.

Use tabbing to understand how the code will be read…

if (c.inFightCaves()) { c.isSkulled = false; c.skullTimer = 0; c.attackedPlayers.clear(); // ^Everything above this line shouldn't be within the if statement movePlayer(3101, 3494, 0); // This should be. } else { movePlayer(2439, 5169, 0);// This should be in the else statement. c.getPA().resetTzhaar();// This should be in the if statement, not the else statement. }

Read full topic

item.title: [REQ] - Tzhaar fightcave respawn
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:10, topic:552478”][quote author=tank nation link=topic=671394.msg4490340#msg4490340 date=1437361919]
Okay so here is what i did, this coding makes me go to the spot in fightcaves that i want it after i die inside of fightcaves… but anywhere else that i die i go to that same spot but it looks as if im at the same place i died but with my tzhaar guys around so i know that im actually back at fight caves.

if (c.inFightCaves()) { movePlayer(Config.RESPAWN_X, Config.RESPAWN_Y, 0); c.isSkulled = false; c.skullTimer = 0; c.attackedPlayers.clear(); if (c.inFightCaves()) { movePlayer(3101, 3494, 0); } else { movePlayer(2439, 5169, 0); } c.getPA().resetTzhaar(); }
[/quote]
Not exactly understanding what you’re saying…
You’ve also got some spaghetti code going on.
You only want the if statement to surround the code that will be affected, nothing more.
You also have two if statements in there, which is why you’re getting a weird respawns for places outside of the fight caves.

Remember the example I gave to you earlier?

[quote]if(inFightCaves()) { movePlayer(FIGHT_CAVES_X, FIGHT_CAVES_Y, FIGHT_CAVES_Z); } else { movePlayer(NORMAL_X, NORMAL_Y, NORMAL_Z); }[/quote]
Notice how the only code within the if statement (and else statement) is the code to move the player.

Now here is your code:

if (c.inFightCaves()) { movePlayer(Config.RESPAWN_X, Config.RESPAWN_Y, 0); c.isSkulled = false; c.skullTimer = 0; c.attackedPlayers.clear(); if (c.inFightCaves()) { movePlayer(3101, 3494, 0); } else { movePlayer(2439, 5169, 0); } c.getPA().resetTzhaar(); }
(I tabbed it a bit better)
As you can see, your if statement goes around the entirety of the code, so when not in the fightCaves, the player doesn’t get moved from their position.
What you need to do is A) Delete this: movePlayer(Config.RESPAWN_X, Config.RESPAWN_Y, 0); (Second line)
B) Delete the if statement that is surrounding all the code.
C) Fix the code in the else statement to use the Config.RESPAWN variables (They are there for a reason, and being ignored isn’t that reason).[/quote]

here’s what i have now, i did as you said and also i put it in my code of applydead the same way…

if (c.inFightCaves()) { c.isSkulled = false; c.skullTimer = 0; c.attackedPlayers.clear(); movePlayer(3101, 3494, 0); } else { movePlayer(2439, 5169, 0); c.getPA().resetTzhaar(); }

Read full topic

item.title: [REQ] - Tzhaar fightcave respawn
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“tank nation, post:9, topic:552478”]Okay so here is what i did, this coding makes me go to the spot in fightcaves that i want it after i die inside of fightcaves… but anywhere else that i die i go to that same spot but it looks as if im at the same place i died but with my tzhaar guys around so i know that im actually back at fight caves.

if (c.inFightCaves()) { movePlayer(Config.RESPAWN_X, Config.RESPAWN_Y, 0); c.isSkulled = false; c.skullTimer = 0; c.attackedPlayers.clear(); if (c.inFightCaves()) { movePlayer(3101, 3494, 0); } else { movePlayer(2439, 5169, 0); } c.getPA().resetTzhaar(); }[/quote]
Not exactly understanding what you’re saying…
You’ve also got some spaghetti code going on.
You only want the if statement to surround the code that will be affected, nothing more.
You also have two if statements in there, which is why you’re getting a weird respawns for places outside of the fight caves.

Remember the example I gave to you earlier?

[code=java]if(inFightCaves()) { movePlayer(FIGHT_CAVES_X, FIGHT_CAVES_Y, FIGHT_CAVES_Z); } else { movePlayer(NORMAL_X, NORMAL_Y, NORMAL_Z); }[/code]
Notice how the only code within the if statement (and else statement) is the code to move the player.

Now here is your code:

if (c.inFightCaves()) { movePlayer(Config.RESPAWN_X, Config.RESPAWN_Y, 0); c.isSkulled = false; c.skullTimer = 0; c.attackedPlayers.clear(); if (c.inFightCaves()) { movePlayer(3101, 3494, 0); } else { movePlayer(2439, 5169, 0); } c.getPA().resetTzhaar(); }
(I tabbed it a bit better)
As you can see, your if statement goes around the entirety of the code, so when not in the fightCaves, the player doesn’t get moved from their position.
What you need to do is A) Delete this: movePlayer(Config.RESPAWN_X, Config.RESPAWN_Y, 0); (Second line)
B) Delete the if statement that is surrounding all the code.
C) Fix the code in the else statement to use the Config.RESPAWN variables (They are there for a reason, and being ignored isn’t that reason).

Read full topic

item.title: [REQ] - Tzhaar fightcave respawn
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:8, topic:552478”][quote author=tank nation link=topic=671394.msg4490334#msg4490334 date=1437359941]

The reason you got errors is because you didn’t include the Z variable, you only supplied the X and Y.
Also, you need to remove the first movePlayer method.

Okay didn’t think the z would be important lol. i’ll retry to mess with it.
[/quote]
It’s important because the method requires 3 parameters.
Please read up more on Java.
I have linked you to tutorials in the past. This is something you should know (It is one of the beginner parts of Java).
Defining Methods
Passing Information to a Method or a Constructor

Note: Parameters refers to the list of variables in a method declaration. Arguments are the actual values that are passed in when the method is invoked. When you invoke a method, the arguments used must match the declaration’s parameters in type and order.[/quote]

Okay so here is what i did, this coding makes me go to the spot in fightcaves that i want it after i die inside of fightcaves… but anywhere else that i die i go to that same spot but it looks as if im at the same place i died but with my tzhaar guys around so i know that im actually back at fight caves.

if (c.inFightCaves()) { movePlayer(Config.RESPAWN_X, Config.RESPAWN_Y, 0); c.isSkulled = false; c.skullTimer = 0; c.attackedPlayers.clear(); if (c.inFightCaves()) { movePlayer(3101, 3494, 0); } else { movePlayer(2439, 5169, 0); } c.getPA().resetTzhaar(); }

Read full topic

It’s important because the method requires 3 parameters.
Please read up more on Java.
I have linked you to tutorials in the past. This is something you should know (It is one of the beginner parts of Java).
Defining Methods
Passing Information to a Method or a Constructor

[b]Note:[/b] [i]Parameters[/i] refers to the list of variables in a method declaration. [i]Arguments[/i] are the actual values that are passed in when the method is invoked. [u]When you invoke a method, the arguments used must match the declaration's parameters in type and order.[/u]

item.title: [REQ] - Tzhaar fightcave respawn
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:552478”][quote author=tank nation link=topic=671394.msg4490238#msg4490238 date=1437282940]

That has almost nothing to do with what you’re asking…

All that file is, is configs… Static variables that are used throughout the server.

You need to edit the actual death handler. Which on a pi is usually in PlayerAssistant or (Sometimes) Client.
What you can do is search for “RESPAWN_X” and then find it in the code that handles player deaths…
Then you need to add an exception for if the player is in the fight caves.

Note: There is giveLife and applyDead… You may have to edit both.

Found this under givelife is there anyway i can change that x and y coord? Or does it have to stay like that?

movePlayer(Config.RESPAWN_X, Config.RESPAWN_Y, 0); c.isSkulled = false; c.skullTimer = 0; c.attackedPlayers.clear(); if (c.inFightCaves()) { c.getPA().resetTzhaar(); }
[/quote]
You should keep it what it currently is, otherwise you will end up making everyone that dies spawn at the tzhaar fight caves.

What you need to do is add in an if statement to check (Hell, you could even use a ternary, but that might get messy fast) if the player is in the fightcaves, and if they are, move them to the fight caves respawn.

EXAMPLE (Example means that copy-pasting this code is guaranteed to give you errors)

if(inFightCaves()) { movePlayer(FIGHT_CAVES_X, FIGHT_CAVES_Y, FIGHT_CAVES_Z); } else { movePlayer(NORMAL_X, NORMAL_Y, NORMAL_Z); }[/quote]

I tried this didn’t work I got this error with it lol.

movePlayer(Config.RESPAWN_X, Config.RESPAWN_Y, 0); c.isSkulled = false; c.skullTimer = 0; c.attackedPlayers.clear(); if (c.inFightCaves()) { movePlayer(2439, 5169); } else { movePlayer(3101, 3495); c.getPA().resetTzhaar(); }

Read full topic

item.title: [REQ] - Tzhaar fightcave respawn
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“tank nation, post:3, topic:552478”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=671394.msg4490012#msg4490012 date=1437067636]
That has almost nothing to do with what you’re asking…

All that file is, is configs… Static variables that are used throughout the server.

You need to edit the actual death handler. Which on a pi is usually in PlayerAssistant or (Sometimes) Client.
What you can do is search for “RESPAWN_X” and then find it in the code that handles player deaths…
Then you need to add an exception for if the player is in the fight caves.

Note: There is giveLife and applyDead… You may have to edit both.
[/quote]

Found this under givelife is there anyway i can change that x and y coord? Or does it have to stay like that?

movePlayer(Config.RESPAWN_X, Config.RESPAWN_Y, 0); c.isSkulled = false; c.skullTimer = 0; c.attackedPlayers.clear(); if (c.inFightCaves()) { c.getPA().resetTzhaar(); }[/quote]
You should keep it what it currently is, otherwise you will end up making everyone that dies spawn at the tzhaar fight caves.

What you need to do is add in an if statement to check (Hell, you could even use a ternary, but that might get messy fast) if the player is in the fightcaves, and if they are, move them to the fight caves respawn.

EXAMPLE (Example means that copy-pasting this code is guaranteed to give you errors)

if(inFightCaves()) { movePlayer(FIGHT_CAVES_X, FIGHT_CAVES_Y, FIGHT_CAVES_Z); } else { movePlayer(NORMAL_X, NORMAL_Y, NORMAL_Z); }

Read full topic

All that file is, is configs… Static variables that are used throughout the server.

You need to edit the actual death handler. Which on a pi is usually in PlayerAssistant or (Sometimes) Client.
What you can do is search for “RESPAWN_X” and then find it in the code that handles player deaths…
Then you need to add an exception for if the player is in the fight caves.

Note: There is giveLife and applyDead… You may have to edit both.[/quote]

Found this under givelife is there anyway i can change that x and y coord? Or does it have to stay like that?

movePlayer(Config.RESPAWN_X, Config.RESPAWN_Y, 0); c.isSkulled = false; c.skullTimer = 0; c.attackedPlayers.clear(); if (c.inFightCaves()) { c.getPA().resetTzhaar(); }

item.title: [REQ] - Tzhaar fightcave respawn
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

That has almost nothing to do with what you’re asking…

All that file is, is configs… Static variables that are used throughout the server.

You need to edit the actual death handler. Which on a pi is usually in PlayerAssistant or (Sometimes) Client.
What you can do is search for “RESPAWN_X” and then find it in the code that handles player deaths…
Then you need to add an exception for if the player is in the fight caves.

Note: There is giveLife and applyDead… You may have to edit both.

item.title: [REQ] - Tzhaar fightcave respawn
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

Anytime i die inside of the fightcave minigame (JAD) i respawn at home instead of outside of the portal where im suppose to be, not sure what’s going on but this is my config.java where it looks like other spawn locations are.

[code]package ardi;

/**

  • The Configuration File Of The Server

  • @author Sanity Revision by Shawn Notes by Shawn
    */
    public class Config {

    /**

    • Enable or disable server debugging.
      */
      public static final boolean SERVER_DEBUG = true;

    /**

    • Your server name.
      */
      public static final String SERVER_NAME = “Solace”;

    /**

    • The welcome message displayed once logged in the server.
      */
      public static final String WELCOME_MESSAGE = “Solace Team”;

    /**

    • A URL to your server forums. Not necessary needed.
      */
      public static final String FORUMS = “”;

    /**

    • The client version you are using. Not necessary needed.
      */
      public static final int CLIENT_VERSION = 317;

    /**

    • The delay it takes to type and or send a message.
      */
      public static int MESSAGE_DELAY = 6000;

    /**

    • The highest amount ID. Change is not needed here unless loading items
    • higher than the 667 revision.
      */
      public static final int ITEM_LIMIT = 16000;

    /**

    • An integer needed for the above code.
      */
      public static final int MAXITEM_AMOUNT = Integer.MAX_VALUE;

    /**

    • The size of a players bank.
      */
      public static final int BANK_SIZE = 300;

    /**

    • The max amount of players until your server is full.
      */
      public static final int MAX_PLAYERS = 1000;

    /**

    • The delay of logging in from connections. Do not change this.
      */
      public static final int CONNECTION_DELAY = 100;

    /**

    • How many IP addresses can connect from the same network until the server
    • rejects another.
      */
      public static final int IPS_ALLOWED = 2;

    /**

    • Change to true if you want to stop the world --8. Can cause screen
    • freezes on SilabSoft Clients. Change is not needed.
      */
      public static final boolean WORLD_LIST_FIX = false;

    /**

    • Items that can not be sold in any stores.
      */
      public static final int[] ITEM_SELLABLE = { 1050, 1051, 1044, 1045, 1046, 1047, 1048, 1049, 1052,11704, 11705, 11696, 11697, 11724, 11725,11694, 11726, 11727, 11728, 11729,3842, 3844, 3840, 8844, 8845,
      8846, 8847, 8848, 8849, 8850, 10551, 10548, 6570, 7462, 7461, 7460, 7459,
      7458, 7457, 7456, 7455, 7454, 9748, 9754, 9751, 9769, 9757, 9760,
      9763, 9802, 9808, 9784, 9799, 9805, 9781, 9796, 9793, 9775, 9772,
      9778, 9787, 9811, 9766, 9749, 9755, 9752, 9770, 9758, 9761, 9764,
      9803, 9809, 9785, 9800, 9806, 9782, 9797, 9794, 9776, 9773, 9779,
      9788, 9812, 9767, 9747, 9753, 9750, 9768, 9756, 9759, 9762, 9801,
      9807, 9783, 9798, 9804, 9780, 9795, 9792, 9774, 9771, 9777, 9786,
      9810, 9765, 8839, 8840, 8842, 11663, 11664, 11665, 10499, 995 };

    /**

    • Items that can not be traded or staked.
      */
      public static final int[] ITEM_TRADEABLE = { 3842, 3844, 3840, 8844, 8845,
      8846, 8847, 8848, 8849, 8850, 10551, 6570, 7462, 7461, 7460, 7459,
      7458, 7457, 7456, 7455, 7454, 9748, 9754, 9751, 9769, 9757, 9760,
      9763, 9802, 9808, 9784, 9799, 9805, 9781, 9796, 9793, 9775, 9772,
      9778, 9787, 9811, 9766, 9749, 9755, 9752, 9770, 9758, 9761, 9764,
      9803, 9809, 9785, 9800, 9806, 9782, 9797, 9794, 9776, 9773, 9779,
      9788, 9812, 9767, 9747, 9753, 9750, 9768, 9756, 9759, 9762, 9801,
      9807, 9783, 9798, 9804, 9780, 9795, 9792, 9774, 9771, 9777, 9786,
      9810, 9765, 8839, 8840, 8842, 11663, 11664, 11665, 10499, };

    /**

    • Items that can not be dropped.
      */
      public static final int[] UNDROPPABLE_ITEMS = {};

    /**

    • Items that are listed as fun weapons for dueling.
      */
      public static final int[] FUN_WEAPONS = { 2460, 2461, 2462, 2463, 2464,
      2465, 2466, 2467, 2468, 2469, 2470, 2471, 2471, 2473, 2474, 2475,
      2476, 2477 };

    /**

    • If administrators can trade or not.
      */
      public static final boolean ADMIN_CAN_TRADE = true;

    /**

    • If administrators can sell items or not.
      */
      public static final boolean ADMIN_CAN_SELL_ITEMS = true;

    /**

    • If administrators can drop items or not.
      */
      public static final boolean ADMIN_DROP_ITEMS = true;

    /**

    • The starting location of your server.
      */
      public static final int START_LOCATION_X = 3101;
      public static final int START_LOCATION_Y = 3492;

    /**

    • The re-spawn point of when someone dies.
      */
      public static final int RESPAWN_X = 3101;
      public static final int RESPAWN_Y = 3492;

    /**

    • The re-spawn point of when a duel ends.
      */
      public static final int DUELING_RESPAWN_X = 3362;
      public static final int DUELING_RESPAWN_Y = 3263;

    • The point in where you spawn in a duel. Do not change this.
      */
      public static final int RANDOM_DUELING_RESPAWN = 0;

    /**

    • The level in which you can not teleport in the wild, and higher.
      */
      public static final int NO_TELEPORT_WILD_LEVEL = 20;

    /**

    • The timer in which you are skulled goes away. Seconds x2 Ex. 60x2=120
    • Skull timer would be 1 minute.
      */
      public static final int SKULL_TIMER = 1200;

    /**

    • How long the teleport block effect takes.
      */
      public static final int TELEBLOCK_DELAY = 20000;

    /**

    • Single and multi player killing zones.
      */
      public static final boolean SINGLE_AND_MULTI_ZONES = true;
      }[/code]

Read full topic
